queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.volumeMounts.name={{dshm}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{hub}}.volumeMounts.name={{config}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{hub}}.volumeMounts.name={{secret}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{hub}}.volumeMounts.name={{values}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{proxy}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-proxy}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{proxy}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-image-puller}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{pull-0}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-image-puller}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{pull-0}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{wait-for-db}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{wait-for-db}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{hub}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-hub}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{hub}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{postgresql}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-image-puller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pause}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-image-puller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pause}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=release-name-codehub-hub.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=release-name-codehub-hub.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=release-name-codehub-hub.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=release-name-codehub-hub.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary
Service has an external load balancer, which may cause accessibility from other networks and the Internet

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-proxy-public}} is exposing a workload, not using an external Load Balancer provider by cloud provider

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node

queries.query_name: Image Pull Policy Of The Container Is Not Set To Always
queries.description: Image Pull Policy of the container must be defined and set to Always

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-postgresql}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{postgresql}}

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-name-codehub-image-puller}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{pull-0}}
